showerReviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed my time here. The hostel has a relaxed, easygoing atmosphere. Social enough to meet people, but not loud or chaotic. The space is clean, comfortable, and has everything you need without any unnecessary fuss. …

Such a great experience. The rooms were clean and had a decent amount of storage. Staff was amazing, and the location was great- 5 minute walk from great restaurants in Little Italy and a 15/20 minute drive to beaches. Definitely would stay again

Decent service and location. Rooms and beds were horrible. Essentially a house that was converted. Bedrooms were upstairs (not accessible). No AC, it was hot and stuffy in the bedroom. Towels can be rented for $2. One bathroom upstairs with shower for everyone to share. Would not recommend

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed here in June 2025 on my last night of a bicycle ride from Santa Barbara to San Diego.  It is a nice facility and clean.  Bathrooms are rather limited for men (the second floor has a single common toilet but also a women's shower, …

Stayed here 12 years ago when the hostel was under different ownership, and it was lovely to be back—lovely staff, comfy beds, and clean premises. Awesome location. I am a very light sleeper so I slept with white noise in my earbuds and slept great. The walls are a bit thin. Highly recommend this place!

Great stay. Wonderful people. The private rooms don't have attached bathrooms but I got the gender neutral bathroom and shower just when I needed it, empty and available. No complaints. Met some really nice people at breakfast. It was a quick night cap for me but good luck to them!

showerReviews.reviewText: This location is great for travelers visiting the U.S. Embassy, as it's within walking distance. However, the hotel lacks good privacy, and some maintenance is needed—especially in the bathroom (there’s noise from water pipes). Additionally, the elevator isn’t fully functional, which can be inconvenient.
